Custody.definition: care or control exercised by a person or authority over something or someone

joint custody.definition: custody of a child shared by divorced or separated parents who alternate physical custody of and share in decisions regarding the child called also

phys·i·cal custody.definition: custody of a person (as an arrestee) whose freedom is under the actual and immediate control of an official
phys·i·cal custody.note: A person need not be in physical custody to be entitled to habeas corpus protection.

sole custody.definition: custody of a child awarded to only one person and usually to a parent

tem·po·rary custody.definition: custody awarded until a final judgment in a matter (as a divorce) is made

sub_terms.c: official restraint on freedom (as by arrest or imprisonment or by release on bail, personal recognizance, probation, or parole) compare

constructive custody.definition: custody of a person (as a parolee) who is not under immediate physical control but whose freedom is controlled or restrained by legal authority

penal custody.definition: custody of a person (as in a correctional institution) as a form of punishment

preventive custody.definition: custody of a person (as a criminal defendant awaiting trial) for the purpose of preventing further possible dangerous or criminal behavior

pro·tec·tive custody.definition: physical custody of a person for his or her own safety
